Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mykonos20
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Had a room in the back. The room was good sized for Europe. Had a sliding door that opened, which was nice. I found the bed very comfortable. Had the hotel breakfast every morning and thought they had a nice selection. The hotel is a block and a half from the airport bus drop off coming from the airport. Going to the airport the stop is three blocks from the hotel. There is a metro stop a block and a half from the airport. The area around the hotel has many restaurants bakeries. I have only one complaint - the volume on the tv's only gos to six. I have a hearing disablity and asked if I could get the volume turned up. I was told the manager (no one would provide me her name) was not going to have other guests brothered by old people or people with hearing disabilities needing the volume louder. The only english channel was very low and could not be heard. So if you can not hear well, you might want to find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great neighborhood hotel just outside the tourist center but within easy walking distance to la rambla”
Reviews.Author: jonathantweed
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location - it's easy to access most tourist destinations while at the same time experiencing Eixample, a great 'real' barcelona neighborhood. the staff is friendly and especially helpful with dining suggestions. in fact, the best restaurant we ate at during our entire trip was BODEGA SEPULVEDA, located directly opposite the hotel's front door. the restaurant's 'low rent 'sign doesn't really fit it's amazing food and ambiance - we never would have tried it had the hotel staff not insisted. there are many other great restaurants all within walking distance. if included in your room rate, breakfast is simple and pleasant... the cappuccino here is quite delicious... but breakfast is probably not worth 15 euros if not included in your rate with so many other options nearby. the walls are a bit thin - you can sometimes here people in rooms nearby. if you are sensitive to noise, be sure to ask for a room facing the back ... the front gets a lot of street noise. one of the nicest things about this hotel is how large and well designed the bathrooms are. after staying in so many european hotels with small and inefficiently planned bathrooms (tiny showers with half walls, water all over the floor, etc.) this was a welcome change. the furnishings are modern and the rooms are a bit spare but the linens and bedding were nice which softened things. the mattresses are a touch on the firm side and tv's could be a bit bigger, but this is really splitting hairs. housekeeping was cheerful and did a thorough job every day. all in all, we'll be back. this is a great little gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location, comfortable and good service!”
Reviews.Author: Frode N
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my business stay and will return as a tourist. The staff was very helpful and went out of their way to assist me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to use as a base for exploring from”
Reviews.Author: Bea80
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel with modern decor. Our room faced the main street and was fairly spacious. We had a large shower, plenty of storage and a mini bar. The only downfall with the room was the fact that the street below was very noisy at night. The staff were always very friendly and ready to offer any help/advice when asked. Breakfast was simple but the pastries and coffee were lovely, and I liked the fact breakfast was served untill 11.30am which was great after a late night. The hotel is well located for exploring the beautiful streets of Barcelona. Playa de Catalunya is a 10 minute walk or the underground is a couple of mins down the street. We got a 4 day travel card (€56 for both) and used the tubes to get around everyday - very easy to use and clean! We got to/from the airport with the aerobus which located 200 metres from the hotel. The buses run every 12 mins and cost €5.30 one way. There are plenty of restaurants near the hotel. A short walk north takes you into the Eixample area where we ate out the most. We had tapas at La Fluta which was around €40 for 2 (incl. drinks) and we had a fab steak at 9 Renias Argentinian. This was expensive but not a typical tourist haunt - def more local. We went to the 7 sins bar a couple of times and drinks were very reasonable unlike the street cafe we sat at in Ramblas - €17 for 2 drinks (1 of which was non-alcoholic!). As a final must, get a pastry from the patisserie near the Universitat tube station - so many to choose from but a great indulgence after all that sight seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy_betshemesh
Reviews.Content: Room was small, with barely a desk to work on. Wifi reception was very poor and the breakfast was basic. Staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bernard K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The decor is modern and clean with the entire hotel decorated to the same style. No meals available, apart from breakfast (served between 7.30 and 11.30) which was simple, but well served. Great quiet location, close to the underground (3 minutes) or a 10 minute walk to the top of La Rambla. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smart and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BB47
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night prior to a seven night cruise. The hotel is well placed just about 2 minutes walk off the Pl. De Universitat (may have spelled that wrong but it's the University Square) which is one of the stops for the Aerobus from the airport. This is an economical way to get into the city at 5.30 Euros each way or 9.10 return and runs very frequently from just outside the airport terminal. We arrived fairly early to check in at about 11 am but the very helpful receptionist told us our room was ready anyway so we were able to go straight up. The hotel is quite modern and very clean, the bathroom was spotless with a walk in glass shower cubicle and everywhere felt very comfortable. We were given a walking map of Barcelona and left to find Las Ramblas, it didn't take us long at all and Barcelona is made up mainly of blocks similar to American cities so it's easy to find your way around. Our first day it rained more or less all day so after a couple of hours walking we were glad to be able to return to the hotel to read and relax especially as we'd had to leave home just after 3am to get to Gatwick for our flight. The following morning we had breakfast which was included in our stay and there was a good selection of everything including scrambled egg and bacon but the hot food was luke warm at best. This was the day we would join our cruise so we checked out but were allowed to leave our luggage until we were ready to go to the port and went to the Sagrada Familia, we asked directions at reception and were told the best way was on the metro the station for which was only about 100 yards away, this day was far more enjoyable as the sun was shining though it was still cold but it was the end of January what more could we expect. We enjoyed our stay at the Advance and when the sun was shining we enjoyed Barcelona, if we return we may well use the Advance hotel again as it is well positioned, clean, smart and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: JaneandDavid63
Reviews.Content: Being just a few minutes walk from La Rambla, this hotel is in a quieter part of the city. The decor is minimalist and elegant, the staff friendly and efficient, the room was small but very comfortable. Excellent shower room. We didn't have breakfast as part of the package but found a very good cafe just a block away - named BLAT! Coffee, orange juice and a pastry or sandwich for 3 of us cost EUR15 approx - but EUR15 would only have bought us breakfast for one in the hotel. And we much prefer going out anyway! I would recommend this hotel for any tourist or business traveller who just wants a quiet and comfortable bed for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: 10Lynn
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel, price seems good with free wireless, 5 min to train/shopping location and airport bus shuttle. Very helpful frontdesk. Modern boutique room and you feel good and comfortable, even though is facing the road, is not that noisy. I happen to miss the shuttle bus at 7am and a taxi driver approach us and offer to give us a ride for the same price of the shuttle bus as he need to pick up pple in the airport. So if you are lucky they will approach you as they are going to airport to pick passengers. The security around the area looks fine as there is a resturant right beside the hotel so there is always crowd around there. I would highly recommend to stay this hotel for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: orih
Reviews.Content: its my second time staying at the advance hotel . i really like the location ,to those who dont like to be in the crowded area , its about 7 minute walk from the rambla & stiil you are far from the touristic busy area , with the local neighborhood coffee shop . hotel breakfast are real real nice , the room are pleasant , so nice & clean . the staff always very helpful , and was very kind. i will retern....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful low key hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doralynn
Reviews.Content: I spent four days in this lovely hotel in early October. The rooms and lobby are modern, but the building dates from the late 19th/early 20th century. There are small balconies on the front rooms, and a glorious large shower shace. The airline I flew on lost my bag, and the front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful, calling every few hours over two days to see if they could get an update on its location.

Reviews.Title: “Central and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Gabriele60
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, five floors, rear windows to a large yard. Quiet room to the rear (in fall), summer may be different if people are sitting on their balconies...windows can be opened, but air condition is also available. Room and bathroom rather large, equipment ok. Breakfast was basics but fresh and ok. Personnel at reception very friendly and supportive, also English and German speaking. As a whole a good starting point (Metro around the corner and Aerobus stop appr 200 meters from hotel) for excursions around Barcelona, but also ok for business purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Little Hotel with Modern Styling.”
Reviews.Author: GodwinW
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent picked this hotel for as a second choice since the her first choice for us was already booked. However we found this hotel quite charming. Staff is friendly. Rooms are modern and clean. You get a nice balcony. Breakfast included and close to tourist attractions yet off the main streets. My only complaint is drunks at night. They can be quite loud. Make sure you get a higher floor. Other than that , it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Quite the Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Xtronika
Reviews.Content: I booked with Avance Hotel in Barcelona for 2 days total. 1 full day prior to my cruise with NCL and the 2nd day after completing my cruise to Italy and Palma de Mallorca. My room was fantastic!! I was suprised to see how clean it was. The size of the room was no bigger than what we would pay for at the Marriot. Considering the fact that most hotel rooms in Europe are quite small, this was suprisingly very spacious. The bathroom was superb and immaculate!! I was offered free breakfast for the 2 days that I stayed. The wifi was pretty good and up to speed considering that I was on the 4th floor. It is locared 10 minutes from Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas, where you can purchase a 1 day or 2 day ticket for the hop on - hop off bus. Although I was there during the peak season for tourists and the hot summers, I wish the air conditioning had a little more power, but overall who stays in the hotel rooms althroughout their vacation? I slept very comfortably at night. Customer service was superb! The two lovely ladies who manned the front desk during the morning and evening shifts did a great job. They always greeted me with a smile everytime I left and entered the hotel front entrance. They even supplied me with a easy to ready map of the city. I highly recommend this hotel without a doubt. I know that I will be staying in this very location when I return to Barcelona next year for a longer stay. This was excellent for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Phil H
Reviews.Content: Had a generally good stay at Advance Hotel. The decor is possibly not to everyone's taste, but no problem for us. The hotel and rooms were very clean, although our room was a bit on the small side. The walls also seem to be very thin as we could hear a lot of noise from inside the room, particularly when other rooms were being cleaned, which seemed to start around 7am. First floor rooms at the back of the hotel have patios outside which is nice, however it did mean we were woken up early one morning to the sound of metal chairs scraping across the tiles as the maid cleaned next door's patio. We had the hotel breakfast which was again adequate but not the largest selection I have ever seen. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the hotel has good wifi coverage throughout, if that is important to you. In terms of location, the bus from the airport drops you only a couple of streets away so it is easy to get to. It is also very close to major metro stations, so very good if that is how you intend to get around. If you want to walk, it is around 5/10 minutes to the top end of the Ramblas and about half an hour walk to get across the old town or to the beach so the location is convenient, but not right in the middle of the action - probably good for people who want to get out of the tourist areas but stay within reasonable distance. Overall, had a good stay here but I wouldn't say it had any 'wow' factor for me. I wouldn't discourage anyone from staying here if the price looks good but I don't think I'll be rushing to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverBarb8
Reviews.Content: I work in the travel industry and travel a fair bit and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. This was my first trip travelling alone and being a female I wanted something in a safe and good location and I found it at the Advance Hotel. The rooms are nice and modern and the bathroom was quite large for European standards. It's a short 2 block walk from the University Square and very easy to get to and from the Airport. I took the Eurobus from the Airport to University Square and walked with my suitcases 2 blocks until I was at my hotel. The Eurobus is only $5.30 Euros each way. On the return the Eurobus is 2 blocks down from the hotel to catch going back to the airport. Catalyna Square and La Rambla are only a 5-10 minute walk as well. The hotel is on fairly busy street and can be noisy at night so if your a light sleeper I would suggest asking for a room in the back of the hotel. Previous to going to Barcelona I heard it was known for pick pocketers. As long as you take precaution I don't think it wold be an issue. I had a money belt that clipped on the inside of my clothes and had a small pack that I wore in front of my body and everywhere I went I felt safe. Typically I came home around midnight from sightseeing and didn't feel threatened at all. Also breakfast was included with my stay and they did have bacon and eggs as well as the usual continental type stuff. The staff was friendly and helpful as well. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: silverfox1942
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ideal for a Barcelona Break type stay as it is close to a Metro, only a short walk to Catalunya Square where the Airport bus and the the Tourist Bus stops, and La ramblas is only a short walk too. Our room was compact but big enough for our 4 night stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. We did not have a breakfast inclusive rate but this was no problem as there was a nice cafe 50 metre away on a corner where we ate each morning. The room was kept nice and clean and we enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the crowds but near everything”
Reviews.Author: Nvizble
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Wi-Fi worked well. Location was in a working neighborhood but close to Plaza Catalunya, La Rambla, the University and public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip barcelona”
Reviews.Author: petermartinZurich
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are clean abd stylish. I recommend to ask for a room to the terasse side. It is very quite to that side. Metro is very close. There are some restaurants around. We had breakfast at a bakery around the corner. All over i would come back again. Only negativ point is the insolation of the rooms. Sounds from the neighbours is really good to hear.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: lqmay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Spain today, and I wanted to write a review while all of the details are fresh. I'll start with the pro's of this hotel. 1) The room was clean and modern. I found it to be a bit on the small side, but we had a very nice terrace and a sliding door out to it making it seem very spacious. 2) The staff were very polite and helpful with directions, recommendations, and phone calls requiring a Spanish speaking person. 3) We arrived early from our all night flight and there was no problem checking-in which was greatly appreciated 4) Very quiet. I was concerned after reading about paper thin walls and the fact that I am a very light sleeper. It was very quiet and we didn't hear a thing the entire time we were there. We had a room on the 5th floor (the top floor), and we had no one above us - that may have helped. The con's: 1) I was some what disappointed with the location. It's true that it is an easy 10 -15 min walk to Las Ramblas, but we found the neighborhood itself to be a little "sketchy" - it was on the boarder of being seedy. We stayed here because we were told that Las Ramblas could be sketchy. We found Las Ramblas to be quite nice...although probably noisy at night if you had a room facing the street. 2) There wasn't a business center. Unless you bring a laptop, you will only have access to 1 computer tucked into a dark corner of the small lobby, and it's 1 euro for 15 mins of use with no printing capability. The desk will print something for you if you need it (such as boarding passes) However, for a hotel that is ranked with 4 stars, I was surprised by the lack of services and ammenities. TIPS: There is a restaurant directly across the street rom the hotel that was VERY good - one of the best we had in Barcelona (La Bodega). If you walk out of the hotel and turn right there is a little joint on the corner that has the best cup of coffee in the city and wonderful pastries and breakfast. Two coffee con leches and two croissants were less than 2 euros. They open quite early, and we had breakfast here every morning before going on our adventures. Each a wonderful lunch the Boqueria market on Las Ramblas - delicious, fresh, and a great value...one of the few value meals we had on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, but ants in the room were a dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: Travelers804
Reviews.Content: Hotel Advance has a sleek modern lobby. The location was a ten minute walk from Plaza Catalunya and the Ramblas. The front staff offered city maps, but had few restaurant recommendations for dinner. They offered breakfast for 15 euro per person; we choose to eat elsewhere, so I can't comment on the breakfast. The bed was firm and the bathroom had a large shower. On our first night there was an ant in the bathroom and then one again in our bed. Thankfully, these were the only two we saw. The room had a note posted stating to always make sure the sliding patio door and window remains locked for our safety. We were on the fourth floor that opened to a courtyard. When I first read this sign, I felt somewhat unsafe in our own room. The walls were also quite thin, as we could hear our neighbors talking. In addition, the temperature control did not appear to work. Our room was so hot the first morning we couldn't get out of our room quick enough. If there were no ants and the temperature worked properly, this hotel would have received a stronger recommendation. However, as it is, we would not choose to return to Hotel Advance.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: worker43
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and the staff was friendly, and very helpful. The location was excellant. IT IS A 5.0!!!! We will stay there when we go back. The room was clean, and modern. The breakfast was good. We got there early from the cruise ship and the staff got our rooms ready early and while we were waiting, the young man that was waiting tables for breakfast in the eating area, went out and got fresh crouissants for us and setup breakfast, and every morning service was very good. I would like to thank him and the rest of the staff for a wonderful stay. This was our first time to Barcelona but not our last. It was 4 couples in our group and everyone felt the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: NickMykonos
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice Hotel near the La Rambla then this is the Hotel that you have to stay. Friendy staff clean rooms and the location is super!!!! Just 50 meters from the next metro station and five minutes walking to the La Rambla I do recommend this Hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: velvetminx
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and had two separate rooms. Upon arrival, it was no problem to change our room from rear to front of hotel - yes, it is quite noisy with balcony doors open, but we liked the view, and the hustle and bustle of everyday life going on outside. Air conditioning is there to use whenever you need it too. Staff very friendly and happy to help with any queries. Mini bar there, prices not too bad, and they rely on your honesty when checking out. Breakfast was included in our hotel price, and was lovely with good variety of food to choose from; also was available from 7.30 - 11.30 am. All of hotel was very clean and comfortable, including bedrooms. Beds a little firm, but we prefer that to a mattress that is too soft. Showers fantastic and plenty of hot water whenever you need it. Rooms serviced every day, they seemed to know when you have gone out for the day, and fresh towels provided every day too. Location was ideal for us; about a 5 minute walk to La Ramblas but even less to the main square where you catch the open air tour bus (recommended). Great variety of restaurants around, even one straight across the road from the hotel. Our favourite place was a bar on corner of hotel's road, very friendly and fun place with delicious snacks/tapas to eat. We never felt threatened throughout our stay and just took great care with our belongings when out. We also made sure we used the hotel's safe, which was free of charge. Recommend visit to zoo if you enjoy that sort of thing. Beaches are great, and get away from Las Ramblas for more interesting shops and better value for money food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A real Gem.”
Reviews.Author: Taron
Reviews.Content: We booked a random weekend away flying out of Edinburgh heading for Barcelona at very short notice, Hotel prices are really variable and we were getting quotes for over £500 however we chose Hotel Advance who were £250 for 2 people for 2 nights. The Hotel is really nice. The rooms were immaculate and nicely furnished. The place is quiet and peaceful and very attractive inside. Being evil smokers we asked for and got a room at the front with a balcony that we could step out on for a fly puff, apparently these rooms are a bit smaller than those at the back but it was still very comfortable with an excellent shower and ensuite area. These guys take pride in their Hotel and it shows, everything worked, no dust anywhere, everything just right. If we go back, I will definitely stay here again. Reception were very helpful and joy of joys nobody bugged us trying to get into the room to clean at godforsaken hours in the morning. The Area is a bit gay with a rather curious bar just down the road but the local cafes and bars are pleasant and cheap compared to Ramblas which is a ten minute stroll through some really nice streets. Markets galore at the weekend, Babs had a field day. Parking is a pain in the neck and frankly a car is probably a waste of money. We needed it as our flight came in at Gerona and left from Barcelona. the underground parking which is only a few feet from the hotel cost about £50 for the two nights. Next time I will get a bus into town and hire a moped for the weekend, much easier to get around on and park and driving in barcelona is a piece of cake compared to other european cities. Pretty much everything we would want to do is within a 30 minute walk from the hotel or you can jump on one of the tourist buses which cover all the major touristy things. I still think the best fun is to be had sitting in wee cafes watching the world go by though and this is a good area to do that in without being ripped off. Top marks for Hotel Advance

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, free wifi but thieves in area”
Reviews.Author: Neox100
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very clean and friendly staff. The shower is excellent and just what you need after a hot day on Barcelona. The nearest metro is Universitat which is just a few minutes walk away, lots of eateries within a few minutes too including several starbucks coffee shops. The hotel is situated in a technology area where most of the nearby shops sell laptops, computer components etc, but the main square is not far away. On the negative side, I had my iPhone stolen from my pocket as a thief raised my hands. However, this was covered by my insurance but it was not a nice experience. This happened just one block from the hotel entrance so I suspect they target tourists. There is no tea/coffee making facilies or bath robes but the rooms are clean and have a patio door for lots of fresh air. The hotel resticts the TV to volume 6 which isn't very high but they quickly increase this for us once we asked. The gay bars and clubs are a few minutes walk away and are pretty good with lots of decently priced drinks and cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “be very careful”
Reviews.Author: eileenandbob
Reviews.Content: i booked my accomodation through lastminute.com who had no problem with confirming the booking for the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel we checked in with no problem but aftergoing to our room, the staff advised us that they had been advised that a fraudulent booking had been made and that they would not honour the lower tariff that we had been offered by last minute.com and that the transaction had been cancelled. We had to pay the full rate which was significantly higher than the rate offered by lastminute.com.. My wife and I were in a situation that was not only insulting and embarrassing because of what they were implying, but due to the time we arrived at the hotel we had no option but to pay the higher rate. Any attempts at negotiating some discount, even though what happened was not our fault and we had made the booking in good faith,was to no avail. Chalk one up for experience but I hope others dont get stung this way

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very safe area”
Reviews.Author: Livingincolor
Reviews.Content: We just returned after 5 nights at this hotel. Upon arrival you will be surprised at the welcome reception area. The hotel is beautiful. When we walked through the door they greeted us by name. It's tucked away, a very modern building tucked amoung the history of Barcelonia. The room is perfect. Plenty of space to put things away so you don't feel like your living out of a suitcase. Bathroom is great. After a long day of walking around, I couldn't wait to for the hot showerr. I was never disappointed- never rain out of hot water. Location is ideal. 1 stop to Pl. Catalunya which is the major change shop for all the lines. The hotel is a clean and safe neighboorhood. We liked being away from the tourist attractions and the noisy bars- so this allowed us the quite of a neighboorhood with direct access to the action. We did not eat the morning breakfast- a bit expensive. However, we found plenty of other options in the area. We did use the laundry service and though very expensive, we arrived home and our clean clothes were neatly packaged on our bed. The room amenties are: in room safe, blow dryer, standard bathroom kits and a mini-bar. What I loved was that there were small reading lights on each sides of the bed, so I could read while my husband slept. I would return there time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes for a City Break hotel-”
Reviews.Author: Missimo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a city break hotel. Its clean, modern and functional. The decor in the rooms is really nice but they are a bit on the small side- we didnt' really expect it to be big for a city centre hotel. Our breakfast was included with our package and we got a very good deal, but as previous reviewers have said I wouldn't pay 15euro for the pleasure. The staff couldn't have been more helpful at reception and had very good english. The hotel is centrally located- I think its a plus that it is located off the Ramblas but within walking distance. I personally don't know what all the fuss about the Ramlas is as we were just the whole time conscious about our bags and money when we were walking on it. In terms of seeing Barcelona I would definitely recommend doing a cycle tour. We did one which was located near enough to our hotel- it took 3 hours but there were plenty of stops in between places so you never felt tired! If I was going back to Barcelona I have no hesitaton in staying in HOtel Advance again. Oh- from the transport side of things the Airport bus actually goes right past the hotel, and we were able to get the bus back to the airport from the street the hotel is on- we didn't have to walk back to Playa Catalunya- the stop is about a 5 min walk from the hotel but on Calle Sepulveda.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and central”
Reviews.Author: SilviaBruxelles
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern, stylish and elegant. Mint fresh condition. The reception was friendly and very helpful. Rooms are a good size and cozy. We stayed in a first floor room with a big terrace - fantastic to enjoy the days sun. The hotel is very central, just 2 min from the metro and pl. University.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a small, nice modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: eshia01
Reviews.Content: Location: It's 5-8 minute from the Universitat Aerobus A1 stop. From the outside airport terminal, jump on the A1 bus. Should cost 5 euros each. Universtat is the 3rd stop, but ask the bus driver to let you know when to get off (as some people don't get off the previous stops and our driver just went pass those stops). Once off, cross the square and head to the right and walk down Ronda de Sant Antoni, then right on Sepulva. Hotel will be on your left side. To catch the A1 aerobus back to the airport, I'm afraid you have to catch it at Playa de Catalunya (in front of the Ignes de Cortes shopping mall). It's 10-15 minute walk to top of the Ramblas. It got quite of a walk after sightseeing all day, so we used the very accessible Universtat Metro line stop 2 blocks from our hotel. Easy to negotiate. Buy the T10 card at the machines. Way cheaper. Hotel: The staff was really nice and helpful. The hotel smelled like scented candles, which to me was a little off-putting. The breakfast was standard but I wouldn't pay 15 euros like some other reviewers. Ours was included in package. If you have a choice, don't buy the breakfast, there a million breakfast options within 1-2 blocks for cheaper! The free internet wi-fi was spotty at times, but I do appreciate it being free. The rooms were clean and had a nice modern feel to it. Walls could be a little thin. I heard other people's conversation from the hallway and heard upstair's toilet flushing. If you stay in rooms 105-108, you get a walkout patio. It was nice, but I was always afraid someone would jump the fences (had a electric wire supposedly) and have access to our room (they did have double locks). Overall: I would recommend to friends, but next time staying nearer in the Barri Gothic might be more convienent. But the key is to stay near the Metro lines which this place does.

Reviews.Title: “liked it, didn't love it”
Reviews.Author: e_onthego
Reviews.Content: There are many things to like about this place and I should have fonder memories than I really do. Likes: ultramodern design - loved it; room - had all basics you'd expect; front desk staff - friendly; close to University metro stop; area felt safe at all hours. Dislikes: noise - Sepulveda is a pretty busy street & there's a dance club next door - be sure to request a room on backside (I didn't, a mistake); location - for most tourist activities, it seems you're 10 minute walk from most things; internet usage for lobby computer was 1 euro for 15 minutes. Food tips for the area - the place just down on the corner (Mutaner) was decent for an inexpensive bite. Also, if you don't want to do the pricey breakfast at hotel, there's a sit down coffee shop just across from the University metro entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and nice location.”
Reviews.Author: cougrz007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Advance Hotel for a short weekend trip in early January. Booked the hotel based on a good rate from Expedia (approx $100 USD per night), location, and pictures of a modern hotel. Location: the hotel is centrally located, near the University Square and Metro station. It is a 5-minute walk to Catalunya Square or to the top end of La Rambla. I was able to walk to all major sights (La Rambla, Barri Gothic, Picasso Museum, Gaudi Buildings) easily from the hotel within 15-20 minutes. The Metro is also very close, although I only rode it one time. Note that the airport bus also stops very close to the hotel. My favorite thing about the location was being so close to everything, but on a nearby street that while busy, was much less busy than others nearby. Room: the room was modern and as shown in the pictures, if on the smaller side (as European hotels tend to be). The bathroom was extremely modern and tastefully decorated. The bed was not the most comfortable but it worked good enough. The heating worked well in the winter, and I believe there was AC if you're travelling in Summer. In short, the room was very modern, as pictured, clean, and in good shape. Service: the check-in service was great, but friendliness at other times could be spotty. One woman in particular was rather icy and unhelpful, but it didn't really matter to me. Overall nothing to raise a red flag here. Amenities: there is free wifi in the rooms, and a computer in the lobby that charges 1 euro for 15 minutes (accepting 1-euro coins only). However, right around the corner is an internet cafe that charges 50 cents for 30 minutes - I'd go there instead. The hotel has breakfast also, but it's more expensive than the cafes/bakeries/sandwich shops nearby. All in all, I'd use these other facilities before paying more for the hotel's offerings. Conclusion: this hotel was a great value and I was pleased with the location and condition of the room. I'd definitely stay here again on such a trip, even if I didn't get quite as good of a deal again.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: MamaLana
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Advance for 3 nights with my husband and our baby. The hotel couldn't be nicer, honestly! The staff were excellent, always helpful and played with our baby so we could sit and have our breakfast. They upgraded our room to the bigger one when we arrived. Room 503 was bigger than the first one that was booked for us but it had no terrace. Probably when its warm outside ask for a room with a balcony or a terrace. Beds are big, showers are a dream! Rooms is very comfortable and has everything you need. Location is perfect! You are close enough to the centre and far enough from the crowds, this is exactly what we wanted. We never used any public transport and walked everywhere ( apart from the taxis to the airport). Its a gem! Very stylish and new!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: manfetti
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location as it's off of the super busy streets and is a bit quieter in the morning... very nice! The hotel is very clean and the staff could not be better..... seriously! My only complaint is that the wi-fi had a weak signal and went in and out constantly which made is frustrating to get business work done. And while this has nothing to do with the hotel itself... BEWARE.... pickpockets tried to get my friend's stuff about 100 yards away from the entrance. The stories you've heard are true about Barcelona so watch your stuff! I have zero interest in going back to Barcelona but would easily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “trendy design, a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: MuddyYorker
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Advance Hotel for four nights at the end of November 2009. On the plus side, the hotel is in a great location for exploring Barcelona by foot or subway. Las Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya are about a ten minute walk away. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance and a great little cafe on the corner by the hotel - I recommend their omelette sandwich for breakfast. The trendy gay bar Museum is right next door and the gay disco Metro is across the street. The hotel is nicely decorated and our room was spotless. We had a room at the back and there was no noise whatsoever. On the minus side, we were disappointed that there was no coffee maker in the room, and no free internet - both features we have enjoyed in less expensive hotels than this one. We were also disappointed that our so-called "king" bed was in reality two single beds pushed together. On the first night, each bed had been made up separately, but the housekeeper fitted it with king sheets the next day. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful but not very knowledgeable - on our first night, suffering from jet lag, we woke up at 1 am and asked the guy at the front desk if there was a nearby corner store open where we could buy a snack. The desk man said no, but within five minutes of walking north of the hotel, we found a twenty-four hour convenenience store! We forgave him because he was rather easy on the eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Pas mal”
Reviews.Author: KellyParis
Reviews.Content: Not too bad, large by european standards. Close to enough to La Rambla to be convenient, far enough away to not be bothered by noise or traffic. Delicious restaurant on the corner. Little cafe with a large menu, ate there 3 times in 5 days, and I am usually not a repeat-diner in such a small amount of time. (To the left when you exit, opposite side of the road, first intersection). Only complaint, there were 3 of us in the room, they did not forewarn of an additional charge, at the end, charged $400 for the extra bed for 5 nights. Kind of bogus. Other than that, gret

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WpgCanuck
Reviews.Content: I read the accounts of the two persons who had been robbed at this hotel with some trepidation. We had booked through Expedia so had already paid and we were meeting a friend there who was already on the road (as were we) and it was too late to make changes. In the end, I was glad we stayed there. True to most other reviews, staff were very friendly and helpful, rooms very comfortable, shower was terrific, free wi-fi, etc. I have been to Barcelona before, but this was the best place I've stayed in and I would definitely stay there again. Location is great, and quiet but close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Owl_86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Advance for Easter weekend 2009 - the photos looked great when I booked, and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is very tastefully decorated, the rooms are very comfortable and have a great bathroom with power shower. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly, and spoke perfect english. The downside was the breakfast, which we thought seemed a bit expensive, so we ventured out to eat in the mornings. This was never a problem, as the hotel is only around a 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas, and there are plenty of patisseries etc. on the way. Getting around from the Advance was never a problem, as plenty of attractions were within walking distance, and the sightseeing bus could be picked up from the University Square, just a few minutes away. Overall, a very good hotel, very friendly staff and - breakfast aside - good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great value, Great location, fantastic SHOWER!!!”
Reviews.Author: markymarq
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by "accident" since I was really looking in las rambles, but when i read the reviews and saw the prices, I decided to go for it. when i first walked up to the hotel from the street, i was already impressed, and I was VERY pleasantly surprised about how nice the lobby is, the very accommodating and English speaking staff, and how chic the whole place is. The room was very nice, had french doors and i always left them open when i was in the room. The bathroom was a good size, and the shower pressure was AMAZING. I miss that shower already!!! the brunch (all you can eat) was an EXCELLENT value. people have commented that it was "expensive". considering how you are nickeled and dimed at tapas places, and how a GOOD cappuccino can cost 3euros or more, i got WAY more value for my money than the cost. fresh everything - scrambled eggs, bacon, fruit, ham, sausages, croissants, cheeses, tomatoes, OJ, cappuccino. I ate everything I think. The location was excellent about 7 minute walk to Las rambles, and 10 minutes to catalunya square. there are TONS of restaurants within walking distance, shopping around the corner (mostly computer / gadget stores) I never felt threatened or worried about my things in the hotel, although when I travel I don't take valuables with me -- just clothes and a point and shoot camera, cheapo laptop and that's it. I'd definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again. you can spend way more if you like, but what's the point if you're out of your room all day long.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! Got robbed in Advance, looks like hotel staff was involved”
Reviews.Author: evilholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Advance hotel for 5 nights or so. We were working couple of days in the hotel before we could start our holiday. The hotel staff were well aware of this and saw us many times with our equipment (laptops etc.). Almost 10 000 € worth of professional equipment. The first night we went out our hotel room was broken into and all of our things were stolen. We had our things locked into secure briefcases, but it looks like the burglars were well aware of this fact as well. The hotel management didn't do anything, they were even reluctant to call the police to the scene after we reported what had happened. We received absolutely no discount or refund, only hotel staff repeating the sentence: 'we are not responsible'. They gave us only a lousy cup of coffee. In our first room it looks like the robbers came in from our terrace and the police officer showed us how easy it is to open their terrace doors from outside. We changed to another room only to find that also there the terrace door had already been broken into once. Our safety deposit boxes were not working in neither rooms. There are many nice hotels in Barcelona to choose from, so I strongly recommend avoiding Hotel Advance.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of robbery and bad management”
Reviews.Author: ParisSimeon
Reviews.Content: Dear all, if you want to get robbed in the hotel room and get no help or comment from the service and the hotel management please be their guest. Few rooms were robbed (service people at the reception admit) and nobody did nothing in the hotel. This is the reason to avoid this otherwise nice hotel. Service people cooperate definitely with the thief, police does not react, the hotel manager doesn't want to get involved. AVOID DEFINTELY!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel, away from the busy nightlife street”
Reviews.Author: Citybreaker2
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel as travelling with mum, so didnt want to be right in the middle of the Ramblas and needed different style to would do with husband! Hotel Advance is very sleek and business like. Hotel staff were helpful, rooms were nice and we had no problems with noise, despite room being on busy street. We were given room on 5th floor which had balcony when you just wanted a glass of wine and 1/2 hour out. Easy to walk to Ramblas on hop on the Metro from the Universtat station. When you arrive grab the aerobus, 7 euros 50 return ish - the machine at the bus stop played up, but you can buy tickets direct from the driver. Get off at Universtat square, couple of mins walk to the hotel. When you do the return journey, you have to pick the bus up at Place de Catalunya, about 5-10 min walk. Great little cafe on corner of the street, have breakfast there, cafe con leche and a bikini (ham and cheese toastie). Good hotel, if you want to pay a little more and not be in the thick of the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seadoo40
Reviews.Content: Nice, modern and quite. Helpful staff. Close to Las Rambas. Helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “classy small hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidPik
Reviews.Content: On arrival by taxi , the young porter jumped out to take our case inside -a very welcoming start. Reception staff very helpfull and gave good advice for first night's evening meal and where to breakfast Bedroom not huge , but very comfortable with a fantastic shower.Our front room wasnt too noisey and small balcony great for soaking in the street atmosphere. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “stylish hotel,tucked away”
Reviews.Author: suzy1812
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Advance for three nights ealry March, initially thought was that it was slightly tucked away, in a slightly less than great part of town...but to be fair i was wrong..its not really too far from everywhere only 500m from El Triangle/Platz Cataluna..and therefore about the same from the top end of La Rambla..most "touristy" bits are walkable (all within 1/2 hr , but jump on the Barcelona Bus (red uns) for 25 Euro for 2 days hop on/off they are great) the hotel , looks pretty stylish from the outside (trapped between a load of computer retailers) and inside doesnt dissapoint...it has a calm , dark,modern mellow feel , the staff are very friendly and informative, the rooms are small (well ours was 208) but hey its a city and they are well appointed and more than adequate for your stay...the bathroom looks pretty stylish with good features and an excellent size....ours room looked the back..not a great view , but we didnt come to town to sit in the hotel room. over all we liked the hotel and would definately recomend it to friends and would certainly stay there again next time we go back Barcelona is great, there are lots of things to do , lots of places to eat and drink,pretty safe...and well worth a cheeky few days on a quid each way with Ryan Air into Girona if you want any more info , drop me an e-mail cheers Al

Reviews.Title: “110% perfect”
Reviews.Author: andycoulton
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique style hotel, fantastic lobby (from which i intent to style my front room), lovely staff who were more than helpful. The room was beautifully well presented with one of the best showers i have ever experienced (and room for 2 ;) ) nice firm beds and lighting for whatever mood. Sky news and BBC worldwide are the only English speaking channels on the tv and i think a music channel would be a nice touch but that is more my personal preference. 2 Mins walk from Universitat metro where you can access pretty much anywhere, a good tip is to get a 3,2,4 day pass for the metro like we did and that covered everything including train from the airport and all metro routes for the duration. In conclusion, i cant wait to get back to Barca and the Hotel Advance it deserves 5 stars not 4. Andy Coulton

Reviews.Title: “Vert nice but take ear plugs and the rooms are small.”
Reviews.Author: LondonMas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights. The room was well appointed but small. The beds were OK. The bathroom was very good with a big shower (although no bath). The staff were extremely helpful. The location is good (you can walk to La Rambla in about 5 minutes). The house keeping was good . The only thing that was bit strange is that the noise insulation was minimal. Overall reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kate08
Reviews.Content: i've just returned from a 5 day visit to barcelona where i stayed in the advance hotel. everything about this hotel is good the room was small but very comfortable and very clean. the staff were friendly and very helpful. the location was excellent less than 10min walk to the rambla a very quiet and safe location. there was a good selection of different foods for breakfast each morning and a lot of nice places to eat or relax over a drink nearby. i would go back again and i would recommend the hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “A++ Advance hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hinnieminnie
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and is highly recommended. The staff were very helpful, particulalry one staff member who was there during the night shift. The hotel is very clean and of a very high standard. The decor is modern, new and maintained very well. The hotel also has a lovely fragrence in the lobby and rooms. The bathrooms are particularly sleek as are the alrge door numbers, meaning you cant miss your door number, when coming home late at night! The beds are very comforatble too. There could eb some additional english channels other than news and a little more selction in the mini bar, but these are very small factors and did not destry our stay at the hotel. The location is excellent with ony a 5-10 minute walk to La Ramblas and Playa de Catalunya. This is a great hotel, at a decent price. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Modern”
Reviews.Author: cdn_traveljunkies
Reviews.Content: We had a friendly greeting as soon as we arrived. The staff were all very professional. The room decor was the same as the lobby, modern and clean. It was as if we were staying in a boutique hotel. The bathroom was very big and modern too. Our room was not facing the main street so we were not affected by any outside noise. The hotel was only a 5-10min walk from Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. We walked to almost all sites (except for Park Guell and Sagrada Famillia).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for siteseeing”
Reviews.Author: briarBath
Reviews.Content: myself and my husband plus 6 friends stayed at the advance hotel from the 31st jan to 3rd feb 2008 to celebrate my husbands and one of our friends 50th birthday's. It is a great hotel rooms very clean and modern , bathrooms excellent There was no bar as such in the hotel although you could have a drink served by the receptionist in the lounge/ lobby area where there are large sofas,. The hotel is about 10mins walk to the rambla but there are plenty of bar's ,shops and restaurants on the way, We had a room at the back of the hotel over looking patios from other houses and hotels , which in the summer i think could be noisy, but then in the middle of a large city you would expect that anywhere, Staff were always very friendly and helpful. No tea making facilities so dont forget your kettle.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: CanBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently (Oct'07). Nothing special - most things previous reviewers said were true: dead-quiet lobby, street noise, rice-paper thin walls. The front desk staff was very helpful, but maybe its in Nov, but the hotel was "dead" i.e. no one else was ever in the lobby, rarely saw other guests, etc. The hotel is very chic, and has potential - so not sure why it shouldn't be livelier. Convenient location to get to most sites, although it is more on the east end of the district (by no mean is it outside of the Rambla area, as its still only 5-10 min walk). I wouldn't recommend getting breakfest there, as there is a great bar/corner cafe just up the block. It is a convenient location to the Raval area. Pros: - good location, off the beaten path - convenient to Raval area - friendly and helpful front desk staff (can arrange early morning cabs to Airport) Cons: - no atmosphere at hotel (at least in Oct) - very thin walls (hope for quiet neighbours) Would I stay here again if I was back in Barcelona? Probably not unless everything else was full.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Frannie50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to finish our honeymoon after a week cycling in Catalonia. The rooms were clean, modern and quiet (we were not on the main road). The staff on reception were friendly and helpful. Located approximately 15 minute walk from the Ramblas or 10 minutes to the nearest underground station. We don't mind walking so this location was good for us. We didn't try the breakfast as it seemed pricey and there are plenty of cafes to try in Barcelona. Considering what we paid for the room, it would have been nice to have a bit more space (it felt cramped), and have a bath as well as a shower. All in all, I don't think we would stay here again, purely based on price.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but Smoke-Free”
Reviews.Author: Notrevealed
Reviews.Content: Our first floor room facing the street was quite noisy on a Saturday night. However, we did enjoy our smoke-free environment.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice”
Reviews.Author: wa7dah
Reviews.Content: it was expensive, the location wasn't good, it takes u about 20 minutes walking to la Rambla ( unless u're running!) the rooms were VERY VERY small and noicey!, not friendly reception staff at all !

Reviews.Title: “Too expansive for its level”
Reviews.Author: LEM-FMM
Reviews.Content: The crew is very nice and helpfull. The hotel is clean and modern, but the ambiance is very cold. We seems the price is too high for the facilities of this hotel, especially the breakfast. The gymnasium is a little empty room. There is just 1 computer with internett connection (extra fee) and no printer! For the same price, you will find many hotels with swimming pool. The position is ok, but not so near the Ramblas. We really don't understand why the rates are so high (compared to hotels at the Ramblas).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nshyr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Advance is a nice, clean and modern hotel just a few minutes (approximately 10 minutes) walk from Las Ramblas. It's very close to the metro, a great bakery (Mistrol!!!), tons of shopping and bars/cafes/restaurants. We had a very nice stay at Hotel Advance. The only two downsides are that the walls are quite thin (we heard our neighbors snoring sometimes). In the morning, the maids/housekeepers are quite noisy when they're making up the rooms (several times we got woken up from their cleaning). Other those two, the hotel is a good gem!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique style in heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Doofler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was somewhat of an enigma - stylish modern interior, clean contempory rooms with lovely bathrooms and a perfect location - positioned on a quiet street less than ten minutes walk from the top of la Rambla, yet completely empty! We did not see another guest during our stay and were always amazed at the number of reception staff available to tend to the needs of just us! We highly recommend this hotel, it is very comfortable and its fantastic style complements the gaudi inspired achitecture of the city perfectly. Our view from our window left a little to be desired, not the usual city view but a vista of residential gardens, although this maybe offered a more interesting insight into Barcelona than a view of the street. We didn't eat at the hotel at all so cannot comment on the food. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: mkirch72
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel prior to leaving on a cruise. Wonderful experience! Great modern decor. Wonderful attentive service. Extremely clean. Fantastic location (less than ten minute walk to Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas). Lots of good, local restaurants within walking distance. Extremely reasonably priced. Service was top notch. Cristina at the front desk spoke perfect English and gave our group great tourist advice as well as a wonderful help in resolving a missing bag issue with Iberia Airlines. This hotel is only about a year old and is in wonderful condition. Warning to those who like soft mattreses - their mattresses are EXTREMELY firm. However, every hotel I've stayed at in BCN is this way. They serve breakfast, but it is expensive. The hotel staff recommended some of the neighborhood restaurants and bakeries. For some great home-cooked food, check out the "Forn de Pa" (Catalan for "The Bread Oven") across the street from the hotel (near the end of the block). Wonderful homestyle food (tortilla espanola, homemade quiche, pizza, croquettes, tuna empanada). I spoke to the owner who said her secret is "absolutely no processed food". Keep in mind that a lot of the smaller, mom & pop stores and restaurants in BCN still observe the siesta and close between 2pm and 5:30pm. Make sure to plan accordingly! As this hotel is fairly new and fairly small, be sure to have the address with you to give to the taxi driver at the airport. For two people and five suitcases, it was only about 25 euros to get to the hotel. For those leaving on a cruise, a taxi to the port only cost about 10 euros, bags included. I will definitely be back to this hotel for it's great service, great location and great price.

HotelInfo.Name: Advance Hotel Barcelona
HotelInfo.Address: Sepulveda 180, 08011 Barcelona, Spain
